summary: Email correspondence between US Attorney's Office personnel regarding victim notification procedures for the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss efforts to identify victims, add them to the Victim Notification System (VNS), and provide notice of the upcoming arraignment scheduled for the following Monday.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the federal criminal case (19-CR-00490) being prosecuted by the USAO SDNY. The correspondence is about notifying victims in his case.

events.title: Epstein Arraignment Scheduled
events.description: The arraignment for Jeffrey Epstein in case 19-CR-00490 is scheduled for the Monday following this correspondence (July 15, 2019).

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein (Docket 19-CR-00490) was indicted by the USAO for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The US Attorney's Office was actively working to identify victims and notify them via the Victim Notification System (VNS) ahead of Epstein's arraignment.

The correspondence reveals logistical challenges in victim notification, specifically a lack of email addresses for most identified victims, prompting a request for contact information to expedite notice.
The USAO SDNY was responsible for sending all victim notifications in accordance with Attorney General Guidelines.
The document indicates the office was in the process of identifying new victims beyond those already known.
